title: Loop integral
summary: In quantum field theory and statistical mechanics, loop integrals are the integrals which appear when evaluating the Feynman diagrams with one or more loops by integrating over the internal momenta.[1] These integrals are used to determine counterterms, which in turn allow evaluation of the beta function, which encodes the dependence of coupling g {\displaystyle g} for an interaction on an energy scale Î¼ {\displaystyle \mu } .
